page.title: 19KEMP TOWN, BRIGHTON.
page.content: Kemp Town, named after its creator Thomas Read Kemp, consists of Lewes Crescent and Sussex Square flanked on both sides by Chichester Terrace, with private gardens in the centre. It was planned as a self-contained entity and was inspired by Nash's development in Regent's Park, London.Kemp Town was planned by Amon Wilds and Charles Busby in the 1820's and was completed by about 1850. Beneath the original Kemp Town cliffs are a series of slopes and esplanades which had a private tunnel under the Rottingdean road to the Central Gardens.The former are now used by the public.This is a Conservation Area- deservedly so- the grandeur of the cream stucco buildings and the green of the shrubs against the azure sky is one of the finest sights of Britain.
